meanings.definition: Publicly declare to be wrong or evil.
meanings.sent1: She was denouncing the unfair treatment of animals in the circus.
meanings.sent2: The activist was denouncing the corrupt practices of the government.
meanings.sent3: The children were denouncing the idea of homework on weekends.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were denouncing the lies he was telling.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outside was denouncing the peacefulness of the night.

meanings.sent1: The teacher was denouncing the students' disrespectful behavior in class.
meanings.sent2: The journalist was denouncing the company for its unethical business practices.
meanings.sent3: The cat was denouncing the lack of treats in its bowl.
meanings.sent4: The painting on the wall was denouncing the blandness of the room.
meanings.sent5: The roaring lion was denouncing the silence of the jungle.
